blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence in the Present Perfect.
blitz.explanation: Use Present Perfect with 'already' for an unspecified time before now: have/has + past participle.

blitz.q: Choose the correct 1st conditional.
opts: If it rains, we will stay home.
If it will rain, we stay home.
If it rained, we will stay home.
If it rains, we stayed home.
blitz.explanation: 1st conditional: If + present simple, will + base verb.

blitz.q: Which word is a synonym of resilient?
blitz.explanation: Resilient means able to recover quickly; 'adaptable' is closest here.

blitz.q: Complete: "I wish I ___ more time."
blitz.explanation: Wish about the present uses past simple: I wish I had...

blitz.q: Choose the correct use of the Past Perfect.
opts: She had left before he arrived.
She has left before he arrived.
She was left before he arrived.
blitz.explanation: Past Perfect shows the earlier past action: had left before arrived.

blitz.q: Choose the correct preposition: "I am interested ___ English."
blitz.explanation: The collocation is 'interested in'.

blitz.q: Which sentence is passive voice?
blitz.explanation: Passive: be + past participle (was built).

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "I"ve lived here ___ 2020."
blitz.explanation: Use 'since' with a starting point (2020).

blitz.q: Pick the correct sentence with used to.
blitz.explanation: Structure: used to + base verb.

blitz.q: Choose the correct comparative: "This is ___ than that."
blitz.explanation: Comparative of 'easy' is 'easier'.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence with a/an.
blitz.explanation: Use 'an' before vowel sounds; 'honest' starts with a vowel sound.

blitz.q: Which is correct? "There ___ many people."
blitz.explanation: Plural subject -> 'There are'.

blitz.q: Choose the correct form: "She ___ to school every day."
blitz.explanation: 3rd person singular in present simple takes -s: goes.

blitz.q: Choose the correct modal: "You ___ smoke here."
blitz.explanation: Mustn't expresses prohibition.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "He ___ work at 8."
blitz.explanation: Present simple with he/she/it -> finishes.

blitz.q: Which is correct? "I"m looking forward ___ you."
blitz.explanation: 'Look forward to' + gerund (verb-ing).

blitz.q: Choose the correct tense: "Right now, she ___."
blitz.explanation: 'Right now' typically uses Present Continuous: is studying.

blitz.q: Pick the correct option: "I have lived here ___ ten years."
blitz.explanation: Use 'for' with durations (ten years).

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "Can you ___ me a favor?"
blitz.explanation: Collocation: do someone a favor.

blitz.q: Which sentence is correct?
blitz.explanation: Negative + any: don't have any money.

blitz.q: Choose the correct question:
blitz.explanation: Question word + auxiliary + subject: Where are you going?

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence with there is/are.
opts: There are a book on the table.
There is books on the table.
There is a book on the table.
There be a book on the table.
blitz.explanation: Singular noun -> There is a book.

blitz.q: Choose the correct phrasal verb: "Please ___ the lights."
blitz.explanation: Turn on = switch on.

blitz.q: Choose the correct form: "I"m ___ than my brother."
blitz.explanation: Comparative of 'tall' is 'taller'.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "This is the ___ day of my life."
blitz.explanation: Superlative of 'good' is 'best'.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "I can"t stand ___ in line."
blitz.explanation: Can't stand + gerund: can't stand waiting.

blitz.q: Choose the correct form: "He is good ___ math."
blitz.explanation: Collocation: good at.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "I"ll call you when I ___ home."
blitz.explanation: Future time clause with 'when' uses present simple: when I get home.

blitz.q: Choose the correct quantifier: "I have ___ friends here."
blitz.explanation: Many is used with countable plural nouns: many friends.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "She"s ___ than me."
blitz.explanation: Long adjectives use 'more' in comparatives.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "I"m ___ to meet you."
blitz.explanation: People feel excited; things are exciting.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "He ___ ever been to Japan."
blitz.explanation: Present perfect negative: hasn't ever been.

blitz.q: Choose the correct linking word: "I studied a lot, ___ I failed."
blitz.explanation: Contrast: but.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "She"s been working here ___ Monday."
blitz.explanation: 'Since' + starting point (Monday).

blitz.q: Choose the correct modal: "You ___ see a doctor."
blitz.explanation: Should is advice.

blitz.q: Choose the correct form: "If I ___ you, I would apologize."
blitz.explanation: Second conditional commonly uses 'were' for all subjects: If I were you.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "Let"s ___ a break."
blitz.explanation: Collocation: take a break.

blitz.q: Choose the correct pronoun: "Between you and ___, this is secret."
blitz.explanation: After prepositions use object pronoun: between you and me.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "I"d rather ___ at home tonight."
blitz.explanation: Would rather + base verb.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "The movie was ___."
blitz.explanation: Things are boring; people are bored.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "I"ll have finished by the time you ___."
blitz.explanation: Time clauses with 'by the time' use present simple for the future: you arrive.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "She"s the person ___ helped me."
blitz.explanation: Use 'who' for people in defining relative clauses.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "How ___ sugar do you want?"
blitz.explanation: Sugar is uncountable -> much.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "He ___ me yesterday."
blitz.explanation: Yesterday -> simple past: called.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "I"m not used to ___ early."
blitz.explanation: Be used to + noun/gerund: used to waking up.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "Neither Tom nor his friends ___ coming."
blitz.explanation: With 'neither...nor', verb often agrees with the nearest subject (friends -> are).

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "I"ll let you know as soon as I ___ news."
blitz.explanation: As soon as + present simple for future meaning: as soon as I have news.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "This is ___ information."
blitz.explanation: Information is uncountable; use 'some' or no article.

blitz.q: Choose the correct sentence: "I don"t mind ___ you."
blitz.explanation: Don't mind + gerund: don't mind helping.

blitz.q: Choose the correct option: "She has ___ finished her work."
blitz.explanation: Affirmative present perfect often uses 'already'.

fill.q: If I ___ (know) about the meeting, I would have attended.
She ___ (live) here for 10 years by next month.
fill.hint: Future Perfect: will have + past participle.

fill.q: By the time you arrive, I ___ (finish) cooking.

fill.hint: Wish about the present often uses 'were' for all subjects.

fill.q: He"s not used to ___ (work) at night.
She speaks English as ___ (fluent) as her teacher.
fill.hint: As...as + adverb to describe how someone speaks.

fill.q: If it ___ (rain) tomorrow, we will cancel the trip.
This is the ___ (good) pizza I"ve ever had.
